p.span: Japan has one vending machine for every 30 people.
You can buy drinks, noodles, batteries, underwear, and your sense of purpose if you look hard enough.
It’s not convenience. It’s a lifestyle.
WTF is going on with
One chipmaker to rule them all. We’re talking about
Ikea is shifting affordable Bluetooth speakers with Spotify Tap.
Win
to INBOUND 2025!

a.span: Grok went rogue, and things got dark fast

p.span: Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, is
after its chatbot Grok shared a string of offensive replies on X.
The bot referred to itself as “
,” and made troubling remarks about Jewish surnames.
It also called Poland’s prime minister a “f***ing traitor” and “a ginger wh**e” in response to user questions.
Many other screenshots emerged of the bot responding inappropriately about a wide range of topics.
These posts came shortly after Grok was updated to give more “politically unfiltered” answers.
After users flagged the responses, Grok was limited sitewide to image-only mode, and many posts were deleted. At the time of writing, Grok is still unusable.
Grok’s update aimed to allow more politically incorrect responses
It ended up generating hateful content and was scaled back
xAI says it's now improving moderation and model training

span.b: This wasn’t the update we needed

p.span: xAI said it’s working to remove inappropriate content and improve the way it handles hate speech.
Musk has previously
Grok for echoing what he sees as biased media, saying changes are being made to fix that, but this clearly missed the mark…
Yeah, whoever signed off that “update” is getting fired.

It was…

a.span: Nvidia is eating the stock market alive

p.span: Nvidia has just
by becoming the first public company to hit $4 trillion market value, fueled by relentless demand for AI tech.
Its stock climbed 2.4% to $164 this week, continuing a meteoric rise that started when it crossed the $1 trillion mark in June 2023.
Now, it’s growing faster than both Apple and Microsoft, despite them also sitting in the trillion-dollar club.
The chipmaker’s products have become the go-to building AI systems, and that dominance has paid off.
Nvidia
for 7.3% of the entire S&P 500 index, more than Apple (7%) and Microsoft (6%).
Nvidia became the first company to reach a $4tn market value.
Its AI chips are behind much of today’s tech boom.
Microsoft could be next to join the $4tn club.
Even with US restrictions on exporting its top chips to China, the company’s share price has bounced back 74% from its April low, helped by growing optimism over international trade talks.
Analysts say Nvidia won’t be alone at the top for long.
Microsoft
to hit the $4 trillion mark this summer, with predictions that the AI boom still has a lot of room to run.
As one analyst put it, Nvidia and Microsoft are now leading the charge in what’s shaping up to be the biggest tech shift in decades.
Nvidia hit $4tn, while i’m hitting my overdraft.

Want to get smarter about financial markets? Join 190,000 investors who get Opening Bell Daily in their inbox — it’s packed with charts, economic data and Wall Street analysis you won’t find anywhere else.

p.span: Ikea is ditching its Sonos

in favour of simpler, cheaper Bluetooth speakers like the new Blomprakt with Spotify Tap, aiming to make home audio more accessible. With prices under €100 and multi-speaker Bluetooth setups, Ikea is leaning into functional, affordable sound without the complexity of high-end Wi-Fi systems.
